alert.note: Alert for Eastern Tucker (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued December 22 at 11:01AM EST until December 25 at 12:00PM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...WINTER STORM TO BRING LIFE-THREATENING COLD....STRONG TO DAMAGING WINDS...AND WINTER PRECIPITATION... ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EST THIS EVENING... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM TO 1 PM EST FRIDAY... ...WIND CHILL WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM FRIDAY TO NOON EST SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy mixed precipitation. Additional snow accumulations up to one inch and ice accumulations up to one tenth of an inch. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow and blowing expected. Total snow accumulations up to one inch, with flash freeze conditions possible. Winds gusting as high as 70 mph. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 40 below zero. * WHERE...Eastern Tucker County. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 6 PM EST this evening. For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 1 AM to 1 PM EST Friday. For the Wind Chill Warning, from 6 AM Friday to Noon EST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Hazardous conditions will impact the Thursday evening and Friday morning commutes. Very strong winds could cause extensive damage to trees and power lines, which along with significant ice accumulation, may cause widespread and long-lasting power outages. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. Roads, and especially bridges and overpasses, will likely become slick and hazardous.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Be prepared for slippery roads. Slow down and use caution while driving. If you are going outside, watch your first few steps taken on stairs, sidewalks, and driveways. These surfaces could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
